definitions.definition: To play music on (a stringed) instrument using a bow.
definitions.example: The musician bowed his violin expertly.
The shelf bowed under the weight of the books.

definitions.definition: To make something bend or curve.
To exercise powerful or controlling influence over; to bend, figuratively; to turn; to incline.

definitions.example: Cronenbergâ€™s "Cosmopolis" bows in Cannes this week.

definitions.definition: To bend oneself as a gesture of respect or deference.
definitions.example: That singer always bows towards her audience for some reason.
I bow to your better judgement in the matter.

definitions.definition: To give a direction, indication, or command to by bowing.
The act of bending at the waist, as a sign of respect or greeting.
definitions.example: The courtier had practiced his bowing.
The heavy books caused a bowing in the shelf.

definitions.definition: A technique for using the bow on a string instrument such as a violin.
